title: US women’s hockey declines invite to State of the Union, men’s hockey also invited in viral Trump phone call
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: U.S. women's hockey team declined Trump's State of the Union invite due to academic and professional commitments.
The U.S. men’s hockey team, which also won gold in Milan, received a State of the Union invite from Trump.
Several women's team members play NCAA hockey, conflicting with the State of the Union event schedule.

title: Patriots cut running back Antonio Gibson to save cap space
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots released running back Antonio Gibson to free up over $3 million in cap space.
Gibson, recovering from a torn ACL, had no guaranteed money left on his three-year contract ending in 2026.
In 22 games with New England, Gibson accumulated 644 rushing yards, 212 receiving yards, and 581 kickoff return yards.

title: Yes, this storm is officially a blizzard. Here’s what meteorologists want you to know.
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Meteorologists declared a blizzard in areas of Massachusetts and Rhode Island, including Boston and Providence, on Monday morning.
Blizzard criteria include visibility of 1/4 mile or less for three hours with 35 mph sustained winds, not just heavy snowfall.
National Weather Service warns of whiteout conditions, potential power outages, and hazardous travel during the blizzard warning.

title: Video captures blizzard conditions in downtown Boston
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Photographer Jack Coen documents intense blizzard conditions in downtown Boston with stinging winds and near-whiteout visibility.
Boston area experienced a nor'easter with potential snowfall expected to reach 18 to 24 inches, according to the NWS.
Pawtucket, R.I. recorded about 14 inches of snow early Monday amid the storm affecting the region.

title: Tom Brady’s WWE comments have landed him at the top of Randy Orton’s RKO list
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Tom Brady called WWE 'cute' during Logan Paul's podcast, prompting Randy Orton to joke about using his RKO move on Brady.
Orton, competing in his 10th elimination chamber match, stated on ESPN's 'Get Up!' Brady tops his RKO list.
Brady will play in the Fanatics Flag Football Classic with NFL stars like Saquon Barkley and Rob Gronkowski.

title: These were Monday’s highest reported wind gusts during the storm in Mass.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Wellfleet hit the highest wind gust at 83 mph on February 23, 2026, during the Massachusetts storm.
Other significant wind gusts included Chatham Airport at 77 mph and West Falmouth at 72 mph.
Heavy winds across Massachusetts were recorded, with many locations experiencing gusts in the 60 to 70 mph range.

title: LeBron James on Jaylen Brown’s MVP chances: ‘I don’t understand’ why he’s not being talked about
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: LeBron James questions why Jaylen Brown isn't more prominently discussed as an MVP contender for the Boston Celtics.
Brown averages 29.2 points, 7.0 rebounds, and 4.9 assists, positioning Celtics second in the Eastern Conference.
Celtics exceed expectations despite Jayson Tatum's injury, with Brown using it as motivation to lead the team.

title: Wachusett delayed opening, ski resorts putting lifts on wind hold
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Wachusett Mountain in Princeton delayed its opening due to a powerful nor'easter with wind gusts of 60-70 mph.
Mount Snow in Vermont and Gunstock in New Hampshire placed lifts on wind hold and operated at reduced speeds.
Wachusett reported 8-10 inches of new snow and anticipated more than a foot of snow by afternoon.

title: Photo scroll: Blizzard whips across Mass. with heavy snow, high winds
author: Samantha Genzer and Jack Pickell
bullets: A severe snowstorm hit the Northeast on Monday, with predictions of over 2 feet of snow in some areas.
Heavy snow and high winds impacted Boston, affecting daily activities and transportation across the city.
Multiple towns in Massachusetts experienced snow accumulation, with residents managing snow removal and coping with low visibility.

title: Market Basket stores in Mass. close early Monday due to the blizzard
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Market Basket closed all Massachusetts locations at noon Monday due to severe blizzard conditions.
Over 50 Market Basket stores in Massachusetts were impacted, along with locations in New Hampshire and Rhode Island.
Several stores in Maine and New Hampshire, including Biddeford and Concord, remained open despite the weather.
